name: Korean Pickled Radishes
description: A crisp and refreshing Korean side dish known as Chicken-Mu. Cubed daikon radish is quick-pickled in a sweet and tangy brine of white vinegar, sugar, and water. This crunchy banchan is the traditional perfect pairing for cutting the richness of Korean fried chicken, but serves as a delicious palate cleanser for any Asian meal.

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the jar in a large pot of water. While that boils, add all ingredients except the radish to another pot and bring to a simmer.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep jar and vinegar

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and dice radishes into little cubes. Add to the jar, let the vinegar mix cool slightly then pour over the radishes and seal the jar. Let cool before refrigerating and refrigerate for about 24h before eating.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: Most commonly eaten as a side with Korean fried chicken but honestly just a nice little crunchy side for many asian dishes.
